poem:
### Headline Echoes

In the damp alleyways,  
whispers like moss cling—  
Jabbar, a name  
etched by newsprint shadows.  

Under florescent glows,  
the city's pulse quickens  
with silent judgments.  

Once, a wheel spun.  
Once, a man swerved,  
caught in life's arresting grip.  

Footsteps scatter,  
a chorus in plastered streets,  
seeking who truly steers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New Orleans: local authorities say they believe ‘multiple people are involved’ in attack – latest updates 10.48am GMT Shamsud-Din Jabbar, the 42-year-old US citizen from Texas identified by the FBI as the New Orleans attacker, peviously pleaded guilty to two charges, including driving under the influence in 2015, reports CNN. According to documents from a US district court in North Carolina obtained by CNN, Jabbar had driven under the influence of an impairing substance in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
